parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.
A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Spain, roughly co-extensive with the modern country of the name. Probably of foreign origin; Spania, a region of Europe.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To fill up, satisfy. Or empletho em-play'-tho; from en and the base of pleistos;to fill in, i.e. to satisfy.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A part, portion, share. From an obsolete but more primary form of meiromai; a division or share.
To send forward, accompany, equip for a journey. From pro and pempo; to send forward, i.e. Escort or aid in travel.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
